### Various Types of Lubricants for the Canadian Forces
#### Tender Announcement

**Portal Reference:** PW-__HL-612-81402, Amendment 2
**Solicitation Number:** W8486-228586/A
**Publication Date:** September 27, 2022

**Tender Closing Date:** October 21, 2022, 14:00 EST

**Background:**

This Request for Proposal (RFP) is issued for the provision of various types of lubricants to the Department of National Defence across Canada.

**Scope:**

The requirement is for the supply of packaged oil and lubricants to the Department of National Defence, as detailed in Annex A (Requirement) and Annex D (Delivery and Accounting Addresses List). The lubricants are to be delivered "as and when requested by the Identified User," during the period from the date of issuance of the Standing Offer to October 31, 2023, with an option to extend the Standing Offer by one additional year.

**Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements:**

The following Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements will apply to any resulting call-ups:

* Nunavut Land Claims Agreement
* Gwich’in Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement
* Tlicho Land Claims and Self-Government Agreement
* Inuvialuit Final Agreement
* Ta'an Kwach'an Council Final Agreement
* Kwanlin Dun First Nation Final Agreement

**Trade Agreements:**

This RFP is subject to the provisions of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and free trade agreements with Peru, Colombia, Panama, Korea, and the United Kingdom.

**Contact Information:**

For more information, please contact Erin O'Neill at [erin.o'neill@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:erin.o'neill@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) or (343) 541-6978.

Download the tender documents from [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca).

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The lowest price will be used as the primary evaluation criterion. Suppliers will be required to submit a bid that meets the requirements outlined in the tender documents. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
